result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason S Beulen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason S Beulen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason S Beulen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Jason S Beulen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

completion certificates.

Defendant Jason S Beulen in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Woller files an amended complaint.  Attorney Smith withdraws his motion.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended charges Count #2 and 3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3.  Count #1 is dismissed outright.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements.  

Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:  Count #2. 
Sentence of:
30 days Jail consecutive to Count #3.  Credit of 30 days, TIME SERVED.  
COSTS:  In lieu of costs - 2 days jail consecutive, 2 days credit. TIME SERVED. 

Court orders the following:  Count #3.  
Sentence of:
30 days Jail consecutive to Count #2.  Credit of 30 days, TIME SERVED.  
COSTS:  In lieu of costs - 2 days jail consecutive, 2 days credit. TIME SERVED.

Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets bail.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Smith files a request for substitution of judge.  Court date to be set.
